meanings.definition: To surpass in capering or frolicking.
meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy outcapered all the other dogs at the park.
meanings.sent2: The children outcapered each other in the game of tag.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outcapered the birds in a playful chase around the tree.
meanings.sent4: The young colt outcapered the older horses in the field.
meanings.sent5: The kittens outcapered each other in a lively game of hide-and-seek.

meanings.definition: To outdo in playful or lively behavior.
meanings.sent1: During the dance-off, Sarah outcapered her friends with her fancy footwork.
meanings.sent2: The clown outcapered the other performers with his hilarious antics.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey outcapered the zookeeper by stealing his hat.
meanings.sent4: The comedian outcapered the audience with his quick wit and jokes.
meanings.sent5: The children outcapered the adults in their enthusiasm for the treasure hunt.
